pilot.name: Pilot's Cabin
pilot.desc: You are in the pilot's cabin of the Starflyer Ganymede. In front of you is a console covered with instruments, gauges and controls. To aft is the cold sleep chamber.

sleep.name: Cold Sleep Chamber
sleep.desc: You are in the cold sleep chamber. In front of you is the coffin-like suspended animation booth in which you recently awoke from your decade-long nap. To starboard is an open door. Forward is the door to the main cabin.

storage.name: Storage Cabin
storage.desc: You are in the storage cabin of the Ganymede. The wall is lined with metal hooks on which have been anchored small objects so that they will not float about in the absence of gravity. There is an entrance to the airlock set in the ceiling and a door to port leading back to the cold sleep chamber.

g_airlock.name: Ganymede's Airlock
g_airlock.desc: You are in the Ganymede's airlock, with the inner door below you and the outer door above you.

a_airlock.name: Armstrong's Airlock
a_airlock.desc: You are in the Armstrong's airlock, with the inner door above you and the outer door below you.

trans.name: Transporter Room
trans.desc: You are in the transportation room of the Armstrong. To your horror, you see a human skeleton dressed in a petty officer's uniform seated to one side of the entranceway, its head hunched over a computer terminal. Forward is a doorway, below is the airlock.

out_trans.name: Outside Transporter Room
out_trans.desc: You are in a long hallway running from port to starboard. To aft is a door labelled TRANSPORTATION ROOM.

out_vault.name: Outside Passenger Vault
out_vault.desc: You are in a long hallway running from port to starboard. Forward is a door labelled PASSENGER VAULT.

vault.name: Passenger Vault
vault.desc: You are in the passenger vault, a chamber so immense that the forward side of it is lost in dark mists. Lined up to port and starboard are tier after tier of cold sleep booths, containing the hibernating bodies of the Armstrong's passengers. To aft is a door.

out_storage.name: Outside Storage Room
out_storage.desc: You are at the starboard end of a long hallway. To aft is a door labelled STORAGE.

main_storage.name: Main Storage Room
main_storage.desc: You are in the Armstrong's main storage room. The exit is forward.

aux_storage.name: Auxiliary Storage Room
aux_storage.desc: You are in the Armstrong's auxiliary storage room. Unopened boxes are anchored to the walls with baling wire.

out_stair.name: Outside Stairshaft
out_stair.desc: You are in a long hallway running from port to starboard. Aft is a door labelled STAIRSHAFT.

stair.name: Winding Stairshaft
stair.desc: You are in a winding stairshaft leading downward to a lower level of the ship. There is a door to forward.

maintenance.name: Maintenance Room
maintenance.desc: You are in the Armstrong's maintenance room. Another uniformed skeleton is sprawled over a console covered with gauges and instruments. There is a stairshaft leading up.

corner.name: Corner of Two Hallways
corner.desc: You are at the corner of two hallways, one heading forward, the other to starboard.

hallway.name: Long Hallway
hallway.desc: You are in a long hallway running from fore to aft.

out_bridge.name: Outside Bridge
out_bridge.desc: You are in a long hallway running from fore to aft. To starboard is a door labelled BRIDGE.

w_bridge.name: Port Side of Bridge
w_bridge.desc: You are on the port side of the Armstrong's bridge. In front of you is a scene of unparalleled carnage. Long decayed skeletons in varicoloured uniforms are sprawled to all sides, some seated in contoured plastic chairs, some collapsed on the floor in grotesque attitudes. There is a door to port. The bridge continues to starboard.

c_bridge.name: Centre of Bridge
c_bridge.desc: You are in the centre of the Armstrong's bridge. You see a skeleton dressed in a captain's uniform, seated in a large chair, its hand perched over the navigational override controls.

e_bridge.name: Starboard Side of Bridge
e_bridge.desc: You are on the starboard side of the Armstrong's bridge. A skeleton in a science officer's uniform is sprawled next to a plastic panel set into the wall.

debris.name: In the Middle of Debris
debris.desc: You are in the middle of a vast assortment of debris. You can go no farther forward.

spacesuit.shortdesc: There is a bulky spacesuit here.
spacesuit.name: a bulky spacesuit
spacesuit.desc: Almost the entire suit, including the flexible portions, is made of heavily metallized fabric, apparently incorporating some sort of iron mesh.

pouch.shortdesc: There is a plastic pouch here.
pouch.name: a plastic pouch

knife.shortdesc: There is a small knife here.
knife.name: a small knife

keys.shortdesc: There is a set of keys here.
keys.name: a set of keys

sonic.shortdesc: There is a sonic disruptor here.
sonic.name: a sonic disruptor
sonic.desc: The sonic disruptor is made of two independently rotatable metal cylinders, mounted end to end.

molten.shortdesc: There is a molten sonic disruptor here.
molten.name: a molten sonic disruptor

box.shortdesc: There is a wooden box here.
box.name: a wooden box
box.desc: There seems to be something inside.

magnet.shortdesc: There is a powerful bar magnet here.
magnet.name: a powerful bar magnet

radio.shortdesc: There is a two-way radio here.
radio.name: a two-way radio

inner.desc: An iris-shaped airlock door, allowing passage between the airlock and the ship.

outer.desc: An iris-shaped airlock door. This one exits the ship.

light.desc: It is blinking rapidly. Below the light is a small blue button.

console.desc: The console is covered mostly with digital gauges that allow you to monitor the functioning of the ship's computer. In the centre of the console, however, are four buttons, one green, one yellow, one orange, and one red.

green.desc: Beneath the green button is the word ACKNOWLEDGE.

yellow.desc: Beneath the yellow button are the words TACHYON BEAM.

orange.desc: Beneath the orange button are the words DOCKING CONTROL.

red.desc: Beneath the red button are the words STATUS REPORT.

petty.desc: It appears to have been typing at the computer terminal.

terminal.desc:
On the video display you see the words:

"SHIP'S LOG, ENTRY 2,349.6.

"Whatever it is, we can't seem to stop it. The carnage is horrible. Most of the crew has succumbed, and I don't know how much longer I can hold out. Even now, the screams in the distance are hideous. Is there any way to"

At that point, the message ends.

booths.desc: Through the frosty window of the nearest booth you see the face of a young girl, apparently well and unharmed by whatever has struck the ship's crew.

captain.desc: Just beneath the collar of the captain's uniform is the monogram JTK.

navcontrols.desc: Considering your rudimentary knowledge of megaship navigation, you shouldn't even be *thinking* of touching the navigational controls.

science.desc: The skull is cracked where it fell against the panel.

m_officer.desc: The skeleton is sprawled across the instrument console.

m_console.desc: Although the skeleton is covering most of the console, you can see a flashing sign at one end. Below the sign is a yellow button.

sign.desc:
The flashing sign reads:

AIR LEVEL TOXIC!
PRESS PURIFICATION CONTROL THREE TIMES!

m_yellow.desc: Beneath the yellow button are the words PURIFICATION CONTROL.

black.desc: Beneath the black button are the words EMERGENCY MONITORING SYSTEM.

white.desc: Beneath the white button is the word ACKNOWLEDGE.

messages.intro1: They told you that star flight would be difficult. They told you and you believed them... sort of.
messages.intro2: What they hadn't told you was how grueling cold sleep could be, how the months and years of your flight would be filled with endless nightmares, countless replays of every terrible thing that had happened to you in a lifetime of terrible things. When the instructions finally arrived from the ship's computer telling the cold sleep machinery to revive you for the final phase of your flight, you were grateful.
messages.intro3: What you didn't realize, even as you stumbled groggily from the narrow sleep chamber into the pilot's cabin of the Starflyer Ganymede, was that the most nightmarish part of your mission was yet to come... and that you would face it fully awake.
messages.intro4:
STARFLIGHT: A Cosmic Adventure
Written & Programmed for the C64 by Chris Lampton
Adapted by Marcus Kamps
messages.lightflashing: A light is flashing on the console.
messages.consolelightflashing: There is a light flashing near the top of the console.
messages.lightnotflashing: The light is no longer blinking.
messages.bluebutton1: A prerecorded voice booms down from an overhead speaker:
messages.bluebutton2: "Congratulations, lieutenant! You seem to have come through the cold sleep with your sanity intact. I don't need to tell you that not everyone does. It's a rough experience, but it's better than spending ten years staring at blank walls, eh?
messages.bluebutton3: "Now that you're almost at your destination, it's safe for me to tell you the object of your mission. Sorry to keep you in the dark so long, but it's an extremely sensitive matter.
messages.bluebutton4: "The Megaship Armstrong has run into some kind of problem en route to the colony on IV Barnard. We've been out of contact with them for a decade. We want you to find out what happened, and report back by tachyon beam. Good luck!"
messages.distress1: The hauntingly human voice of the ship's computer booms down from the overhead speakers:
messages.distress2: "Automated distress signal being received from the Megaship Armstrong. Is a rendezvous desired? Immediate acknowledgement requested!"
messages.rendezvous2: As you watch through the forward viewscreen, the stars seem to change position around you. A distant point of light swells until it becomes a starship. As it comes closer, you recognize the mindboggling bulk of an immense megaship, a starship as large as a small planet. On its side, in large red letters, are the words GCC ARMSTRONG. The Ganymede finally comes to a halt directly beneath the Armstrong's belly.
messages.cantdock: The docking machinery whines uselessly, since there is nothing within the vicinity with which it can dock.
messages.dock: The Ganymede rises until it is touching the Armstrong. A loud grinding noise informs you that the airlocks are now connected and the ships are docked.
messages.undock: The Ganymede and Armstrong disconnect airlocks and undock. The Ganymede floats downward until about fifty metres of space separate it from the Armstrong.
messages.tachyon: There is a crackle from the overhead speaker, then you hear the voice of the communications officer back at base headquarters, transmitted to you via tachyon beam. You tell her what has happened. She replies:
messages.noprogress: "Please get back in contact after you've made some progress in your mission."
messages.horrible: "My God, that's horrible! Find out what happened and report back immediately!"
messages.astonishing: "What an astonishing story! You must save the ship's passengers from this malevolent force before it can escape again. It will be two years before we can have another ship in your vicinity! Report back when you're done!"
messages.congratulations1: "Congratulations! You've succeeded admirably! The new crew will arrive in two years. Come on home!"
messages.congratulations2: Smiling, you return to the cold sleep booth and sink into its depths. Your fear of the coming nightmares is offset by thought of the hero's welcome that awaits you when you return home. But even as the cold sleep begins, you see an image in the back of your mind of a malevolent evil force, ready to spring on you as soon as you surrender to the oncoming sleep...
messages.airclosed: The airlock door is closed. You can't go that way.
messages.openinnerdoor: The inner door is now open.
messages.closeinnerdoor: The inner door is now closed.
messages.openouterdoor: The outer door is now open.
messages.closeouterdoor: The outer door is now closed.
messages.closeotherdoor: The other door must be closed first.
messages.inneropenouterclosed: The inner door is open and the outer door is closed.
messages.innerclosedouteropen: The inner door is closed and the outer door is open.
messages.innerclosedouterclosed: The inner door is closed and the outer door is closed.
messages.spacednosuit: A violent gust of air pulls you from the airlock into the void of space. You are briefly aware of the Starflyer Ganymede receding into the distance, then you lose consciousness... forever.
messages.spacedwithsuit1: A violent gust of air pulls you from the airlock into the void of space. The Starflyer Ganymede recedes rapidly into the distance, dwindling until it is no more than a point of light among the stars.
messages.spacedwithsuit2: Your spacesuit has sufficient oxygen to sustain you for 72 hours adrift in space, cold comfort considering that your chances of rescue are effectively nil.
messages.finishdocking: Perhaps you should have finished docking with the Armstrong...
messages.pullforcewithyou: For what it's worth, the malevolent force is also pulled into the depths of space with you, so that it can no longer menace the passengers on board the Armstrong. You have succeeded in your mission, but have lost your life...
messages.airlockfumes: Dim light floods in from the airlock of the Armstrong – and a cloud of noxious fumes floods in as well. You begin to choke and try to close the doors, but it's too late. You are losing consciousness. Your final thought is that you should have worn the spacesuit. It might have saved your life...
messages.suitfumes: ...but you should have left it on! Noxious fumes inside the Armstrong asphyxiate you within seconds!
messages.openairlockmagnet: As the outer door opens, air bursts explosively into the vacuum of space, but you are held fast within the airlock by the strong grip of the bar magnet against the metallized glove of your spacesuit.
messages.openairlockforce: A screaming sound inside your head tells you that the malevolent force has been yanked back into the vacuum of space from which it came, and can no longer menace the crew members of the Armstrong. You rejoice inwardly! You have accomplished your assigned mission and now have only to report back to headquarters!
messages.outerdoorstillopen: You don't really want to do that. The outer door is still open, leaving you exposed to the void of space.
messages.somethinginpocket: You find something in the pocket.
messages.jammed: You can't. The panel's unlocked, but it's jammed shut, probably from the force of the science officer's body falling against it.
messages.strongerthanknife: You'll need something stronger than a knife.
messages.cantprypanel: You attempt to pry the locked panel with the crowbar, but are unsuccessful.
messages.prypanel: You pry open the panel with the crowbar.
messages.panelopen: The panel is open, revealing a computer video screen, a black button and a white button.
messages.emergencysystem1: There is a rumble from a speaker set into the science officer's console, then a voice speaks:
messages.emergencysystem2: "This is the Armstrong's computerized emergency system. Since the crew of the Armstrong is now dead and all of the passengers remain in cold sleep, it is assumed that you are an outsider responding to the distress signal. Here are the details of the current emergency situation:
messages.emergencysystem3: "An invisible, malevolent force has entered the Armstrong during a routine EVA. All crew members are deceased. Over the course of ten years, I have maneuvered the invading entity into the auxiliary storage area, behind the main storage room, where it is now imprisoned, though perhaps not for long. If you wish me to unlock the door to this room, please acknowledge immediately!"
messages.storageunlocked2: "Door to the auxiliary storage room is now unlocked."
messages.openfellout: Okay. It's open... and something fell out.
messages.cutpouch: You cut open the pouch with the knife.
messages.alreadycut: It's already been cut, thank you.
messages.twistdisruptor: You twist the disruptor until it clicks.
messages.glowingnumeral: A glowing numeral %VAR(sonic) appears on one side of the sonic disruptor.
messages.disruptorbursts: The sonic disruptor bursts forth with a spray of high-frequency sound that atomizes everything in its immediate vicinity... yourself included.
messages.destroyedfurniture: For what it's worth, you did succeed in destroying the piece of furniture that had been blocking the stairshaft.
messages.heardisruptor: In the distance, you hear the piercing whine of a sonic disruptor atomizing everything in its vicinity.
messages.heardisruptorshatter: In the distance, you hear the piercing whine of a sonic disruptor atomizing everything in its vicinity, accompanied by the sound of shattering plastic.
messages.forceinroom: You are aware of a powerful, invisible force in the room with you.
messages.jolt1: Your entire nervous system is jolted by a mental force the likes of which you have never experienced. Your head jerks back and your mouth opens in an involuntary scream. From the neck down your body is completely paralyzed, immobile; then the force relents and you go limp.
messages.jolt2: A second jolt, more powerful than the first and infinitely more painful, surges through your nervous system. For a moment you do not even recognize the sound of your own scream. After what seems like several eternities, the pain goes away.
messages.jolt3: The third jolt strikes you like a crackling bolt of lightning. The duration is shorter this time, because your weakened heart is incapable of sustaining further pain of this intensity. Within seconds you slump dead against the nearest wall, wondering in your last instant of consciousness just who will discover *your* decaying skeleton...
messages.healthhp3: You're in fine health... for the time being, anyway.
messages.healthhp2: The shock to your nervous system has left you in ragged shape. You are wobbly, disoriented, and slightly nauseous. You should avoid additional shocks of this nature.
messages.healthhp1: You are in critical condition. One more shock like that last one and your star-flying days will come to an abrupt halt.
messages.nosleep: You don't really want to do that. If you re-enter the suspended animation booth and revert to cold sleep, the ship will automatically return to its home port. Your mission will be a failure.
messages.skeletons: You step cautiously over a pair of skeletons that have fallen together in the middle of the hallway.
messages.vaultlarge: You don't really want to go that way. The passenger vault is so large that you could wander in it for days, to no particular avail.
messages.electroniclock: The door is locked electronically and can only be unlocked by order of the ship's computer system.
messages.dropsuit: The hall ahead of you is crammed with debris and the skeletal remains of the Armstrong's crew members. Unfortunately, you will need to drop your bulky space suit before you can squeeze through the debris.
messages.squeeze: The hall ahead of you is crammed with debris and the skeletal remains of the Armstrong's crew members. You are barely able to squeeze through the debris.
messages.blockedfurniture: There is a large item of plastic furniture blocking your descent. Below the plastic, you can just make out the skeletal remains of one of the crew members, who had apparently placed the furniture here in an unsuccessful attempt to ward off an attacker.
messages.descend: You descend into the shaft, picking your way past the shattered remains of the piece of plastic furniture and the skeleton that was holding it in place.
messages.airispure: You hear a hissing sound from the ventilation system. After a few moments the sign on the control panel indicates that the air is pure enough to breathe.
messages.signnotflashing: The sign is no longer flashing.
messages.takemagnet: With a bone-wrenching tug, you pull the magnet loose from the metal bulkhead where it had attached itself.
messages.dropmagnet: You drop the magnet. With a powerful leap and a loud clang, it attaches itself to the nearest metal bulkhead.
messages.clingstofingers: It clings to the metallic fingers of your spacesuit glove.
messages.immobilized: The fingers of your spacesuit attach themselves tightly to the magnet. Since you are *in* the spacesuit, you are temporarily immobilized.
messages.pullfreeofmagnet: First, you tug yourself free of the bar magnet...
messages.dontknowhowsomething: I don't know how to %1 something.
messages.nolongerwearing: You are no longer wearing the %2.
messages.gameover: Would you like to play again?
